ui.locationHelp: You can allow automatic location, enter coordinates, or search by place name.
ui.manualHelp: On Google Maps, long‚Äëpress a point and copy the latitude/longitude shown into these fields.
ui.nameHelp: You can type a city, district, country or full address.

ui.inspHelp: These are short reminder-style translations. For full text, refer to a mushaf or a trusted source.

ui.calHelp: Shows imsak, fajr and maghrib times for Ramadan of the chosen year at your selected location.
ui.calStatusNoData: No Ramadan data found for this year. Check the year and location.
ui.countdownPrefix: Time left until end of current prayer
ui.countdownFinished: All prayer times for today have passed.

Fajr: ‚ÄúCelebrate His praise in the late hours of the night and at the ends of the day.‚Äù (Qaf 50:40)
Sunrise: ‚ÄúHe has subjected the sun and the moon for you.‚Äù (Ibrahim 14:33)
‚ÄúHe is the One who causes the dawn to break.‚Äù (Al‚ÄëAn‚Äòam 6:96)
Dhuhr: ‚ÄúEstablish prayer from the decline of the sun.‚Äù (Al‚ÄëIsra 17:78)
‚ÄúIndeed, prayer has been decreed upon the believers at fixed times.‚Äù (An‚ÄëNisa 4:103)
Asr: ‚ÄúBy time, indeed mankind is in loss.‚Äù (Al‚ÄëAsr 103:1‚Äë2)
Maghrib: ‚ÄúEstablish prayer until the darkness of the night.‚Äù (Al‚ÄëIsra 17:78)
‚ÄúGlorify your Lord before the setting of the sun.‚Äù (Qaf 50:39)
Isha: ‚ÄúAnd in a part of the night prostrate yourself to Him.‚Äù (Al‚ÄëInsan 76:26)
‚ÄúStand for prayer at night, except for a little.‚Äù (Al‚ÄëMuzzammil 73:2)

ramadanNotes: ‚ÄúO you who believe, fasting is prescribed for you as it was prescribed for those before you.‚Äù (Al‚ÄëBaqarah 2:183)
‚ÄúWhoever fasts Ramadan with faith and hoping for reward will have his past sins forgiven.‚Äù (Hadith meaning)
